summary: This is an email from an FBI agent informing colleagues about travel to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment. The email indicates interviews will begin the next day, with most victims located in the Miami/West Palm Beach area and two in Winter Gardens and Palm Harbor.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Author of the email, identifies as SSA of Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) at the FBI New York office, and is coordinating travel to Florida to interview victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the arrest and indictment that prompted the victim interview travel.

connections.description: Sean, as an FBI agent, is involved in the investigation following Epstein's arrest, specifically coordinating victim interviews.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and Indigation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and indicted, prompting an FBI response to interview victims.

events.title: FBI Victim Interviews in Florida
events.description: FBI agents from New York travel to Florida to begin interviewing approximately 25 victims of Epstein.

keyFacts: The email was sent on July 9, 2019, following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment.
FBI agents from New York were traveling to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims, with interviews starting the next day (July 10, 2019).
Most victims were located in the Miami/West Palm Beach area, with two specific victims believed to be in Winter Gardens and Palm Harbor.
The coordinating agent, Sean, was a Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) with Squad C-20, focusing on Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking.
The communication serves as an FYI to colleagues in the Tampa Area of Responsibility (AOR) about the FBI's investigative activities in their region.
